issue.title: paypal.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin v1.64.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.paypal.com/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### Issue:
Various issues (e.g. problem signing in, completing payments and accessing subpages).

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Tracking Protection filter**

### Problem rule:
`||datadome.co^$third-party`

### Blocked script:
`https://ct.ddc.paypal.com.fpc.datadome.co/i.js`

### Screenshots:
* **Error:** https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6d301421-b340-4994-8bc2-c8d082584e1a
* **uBO's logger:** https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5c20beab-d516-4200-966e-2f3e6d3ad06e

### Possible fix:
```
- ||datadome.co^$third-party

+ ||datadome.co^$third-party,domain=~paypal.com
```
### Temp fix:
`@@||paypal.com.fpc.datadome.co/i.js`

### Other problem filters:
* **EasyPrivacy** https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/22014/
`||datadome.co^$third-party`

--

### System info:
* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v140.0.2-1 (x64) [Tracking Protection = Standard]
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.64.0


### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Of course, but it doesn't really hurt to simply keep the exception, does it?

It does hurt, you're giving datadome tracker access to paypal details for all.

comment.body:
Yes, it is still actual.

- Disable - re-enable content blockers in Safari for the website - DONE
- Filters updated - DONE
- Do not close AdGuard window 60 seconds - DONE. BTW, it is not iOS, it is macOS - DONE
- Disabled 'User rules' and 'Allowlist' categories - DONE

It didn't help, I still see the cookie warning overlay on Arstechnica website.

I enabled verbose logging in the AdGuard's settings and tried to refresh the page with address 'https://arstechnica.com/health/2025/07/rfk-jr-s-health-department-calls-nature-junk-science-cancels-subscriptions/' 

Logs are attached, maybe it will help to shed a light over the situation. Refresh events should be from Jul 2nd, 9:32 - 9:34 am Eastern European Summer Time.

[adg_safari_logs_1751438061751.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21012628/adg_safari_logs_1751438061751.zip)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It seems the problem with timings - on iOS some rules cannot be executed in time, like on Android, and ad script may be executed (race condition).
We have the necessary rules, and on my device popup script sometimes is blocked, and sometimes - not.
